title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.21 Part 2 | 24-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्य ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
दमा ओम विष्णु पाधाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्री मते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गवरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा श्रीवास अधी गवरभक्त वृन्दा

Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Jai Vanarottamam Deviim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet

In this session we will be discussing from the 21st verse of the 12th chapter of the 1st canto. We already discussed the 1st portion of this verse. In this session we will be discussing the 2nd portion of this verse.
So just to refresh your memory the verse itself is as follows.
The meaning of this 21st verse is amongst great bowmen
this child will be as good as Arjuna.
He will be as irresistible as fire
and as unsurpassable as the ocean.
So Shri La Pravupal explains in the purport that in history there are two Arjunas.
That's why the mention is made Arjuna Yordva Yoho.
One is called Kartya Viri Arjuna.
He is very famous in history.
He has a great king, powerful king and the other is the grandfather of Pariksit.
Arjuna, the grandfather of Pariksit, the Pandava, Arjuna and both of them are famous for being expert in fighting in bowmanship.
So, Shri La Pravupal has elaborately described the personality of the Pandava Arjuna.
And in the previous session, we heard about the history of this Pandava Arjuna.
Till the stage where Arjuna learnt.
under professor Dronacharya, where Dronacharya taught him personally different kinds of secret astras, mantra weapons, and the description is further given by Srila Pramupada in the purport.
Maharaj Drupada, Drupada was actually a king of the province called Panchaladesha, and he had as his son and daughter Drishtadyumna and Draupadi.
He was defeated by Arjuna on behalf of professor Dronacharya.
The history is that Drupada and Dronacharya, when they were young students, they studied in the same Guruko, and they were good friends in the Guruko.
the rich son of the rich Kshatriya.
Drupada was the son of a very powerful and rich Kshatriya.
And Dronacharya was the son of a poor Brahmana.
So when Drupada grew up, he became the king of the province called Panchaladesha.
And Dronacharya grew up, but he was just a poor Brahmana's son.
So he was another poor Brahmana.
Now during the Gurukul days, because they were very good friends.
Once Drupada, in a, on a certain occasion, he promised to Dronacharya.
I will give you half of my kingdom because I am the only son of my father.
So I will give you half of my kingdom.
You don't have to suffer in poverty like your father.
So Dronacharya took these words of Drupada to heart.
And he always remembered, even when they went back to their own country.
When they went back to their own home after completing the Gurukul education.
And Dronacharya was living in utter poverty.
So after he got married and he had a son, Ashwatthama, small boy.
The boy one day began to cry to his mother that I have not tasted what is real milk.
All my friends say milk is very, very nourishing and very, very tasty and very nice to drink.
But I don't know what is milk.
She felt very bad that they were in such poverty stricken condition.
That they could not feed their child cow's milk.
told her husband Dronacharya that we are so poor.
We cannot even feed our child some cow's milk.
I will go to my friend.
beg from him in charity a cow.
He has promised to give me half his kingdom.
But I don't want his wealth in that way.
But I will just ask for a cow donation.
So he set out from his place to visit Maharaj Drupada in Panchala Desha.
And because he was a brahmana.
There was no restriction for brahmanas going and meeting kings.
And when he came in presence of Drupada.
So then he said you don't remember me.
I am your friend from Gurukul days.
He thought it is an insult that a wretched.
With a rich and powerful king.
That friendship is always between equals.
So you are a poor and wretched.
How can you be my friend?
What is my status and what is your status?
So Dronacharya was feeling very very insulted.
That this Drupada has become very proud of his power and his position and his wealth.
I am going to teach him a lesson.
He did not utter a single word.
Dronacharya was appointed as the teacher.

Dronacharya was powerful enough to kill Drona himself. Dronacharya never hesitated to impart all the military secrets to this boy because he was a Kshatriya and he had come seeking training in the military arts.

So Dronacharya as a liberal Brahmana he taught everything, all the military science to this Drupada's son and that Drupada's son was ready to fight against the Kauravas when he was fighting on the side of the Pandavas and Dronacharya was on the side of the Kauravas.
So Drupada even though he was defeated by Arjuna, still Drupada recognized that Arjuna is the best match for his daughter Draupadi.
So Drupada decided to hand over his daughter Draupadi to Arjuna but he was disappointed when he heard the false news of Arjuna's death in a fire.
Arjuna was a coward for Arjuna but he fought to stop Drona but Arjuna was very over- przygot for Anna via Arjuna's이줅 Çalakkä месяக
He became very sad because he didn't find Dronak Grandpa once and gave the Dronakỉ�석 the royal Cal discoveries and whatever Kauravas give he gave then to Arjuna.
So Drona experienced though the great difficulties of Pandavas especially Arjuna Od dragons.
Arjuna was Hotel of Arjuna's Charity for some time but he was unable to get rid of his brothers as they were protected by Krishna.
He was unable to have Kriya to protect them but he was able to
Thus Arjuna tried to set fire to Dronakliga but everyone was Cuz in his story.
all those Kriyas were stable at the super su apologies.
Arjuna was ruined andセo m entendeu

house shellac house into which the Pandavas were sent and before Duryodhana could set fire the Pandavas escaped through a secret tunnel they dug in the earth and when they were living incognito after escaping that is when Drupada decided to hold a Swayamvara ceremony for marrying Draupadi

and he arranged Draupadi's personal selection of a groom who could pierce the eye of a fish hanging on the ceiling. This trick was made especially because only Arjuna could do it and he somehow thought that Arjuna was killed in that fire of the shellac house but actually the Pandavas had escaped.

When the Pandavas heard about Drupada's deciding to hold a Swayamvara ceremony for marrying his daughter the Pandavas went there for that ceremony. Of course they were living incognito as brahmanas. They were dressed as some poor brahmanas.
So they went there and when all the other Kshatriya kings were there they were dressed as some poor brahmanas.

When the Pandavas heard that the Kshatriya kings failed to pass the test set by Drupada then Arjuna in the guise of a poor brahmana he passed the test and Draupadi was garlanded sorry Draupadi garlanded Arjuna though she did not know he was Arjuna.
And later on Lord Krishna disclosed Arjuna's identity.
To Balaram and when Drupada came to know that this poor brahmana is Arjuna he was very very very happy to marry his daughter to Arjuna.
So I will stop here. We will continue in the next session.
